intro: Cyclotrichium longiflorum, commonly known as the long-flowered tickseed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the central and eastern United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10 to 30 centimeters, featuring slender stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow with a distinctive white or pale yellow center, blooming from June to September. Cyclotrichium longiflorum is often found in open woods, fields, and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils.
